senses.de: To happen at the same time as something else
senses.ex: The release of the new phone will coincide with the company's anniversary

Tips.title: Simultaneous Events
Tips.description: Use 'coincide' to emphasize events happening at exactly the same moment.
Tips.example: The two festivals coincide this year, creating a huge celebration.

Tips.title: Planned Timing
Tips.description: 'Coincide' often implies purposeful arrangement so events align.
Tips.example: The meeting was scheduled to coincide with the CEO's visit.

Tips.title: Implicit Surprise
Tips.description: Sometimes 'coincide' suggests an unexpected alignment of events.
Tips.example: It's a coincidence that our holidays coincide; we didn't plan it!

senses.de: To be in the same place or have the same characteristics as something else
senses.ex: Her story coincides with the other witness's testimony

Tips.title: Matching Details
Tips.description: Use 'coincide' when different parts or aspects are in exact agreement.
Tips.example: The accounts from both witnesses coincide in every detail.

Tips.title: Consistency Validation
Tips.description: 'Coincide' can verify that two sources or stories are consistent.
Tips.example: Their testimonies need to coincide for the story to be credible.

Tips.title: Complete Agreement
Tips.description: Emphasize the totality of an agreement by saying 'coincide entirely'.
Tips.example: Their philosophies don't just overlap; they coincide entirely.

Agree.wordDefinition:
Agree means to have the same opinion or to come to the same conclusion as another person.

For example: "We all agree that the new policy is a good idea."

Agree is used when two people have the same opinion, while coincide is used for two events that happen at the same time.

Align.wordDefinition:
Align means to put things in a straight line or in a proper arrangement. It suggests a deliberate and intentional action to bring things into agreement or harmony.

For example, if you were trying to line up a row of books on a shelf, you would use the word align because it requires a deliberate action.

Concur.wordDefinition:
Concur means that two or more individuals have the same opinion or agree on something. For example, if two friends agree that a movie was good, they can be said to concur with each other.

Coincide refers to a chance occurrence, while concur refers to agreement or accord of opinion.

Correspond.wordDefinition:
Correspond means to match or be similar to something else.

Coincide describes when two things happen at the same time, while correspond describes when two things match or are similar in some way.

Harmonize.wordDefinition:
Harmonize means to blend in or match well with something else.

It is used when two or more things complement each other and work together in a synchronized manner. For example, if two musical instruments are played together in perfect synchronization, we can say they harmonize.

Coincide is used when two or more things happen together by chance, while harmonize is used when two or more things work together in a synchronized manner.

Match.wordDefinition:
Match means to be identical or similar to something else.

Example: The color of my shirt and my shoes match perfectly!

Coincide means an unplanned occurrence, and match means a specific similarity.

Overlap.wordDefinition:
Overlap means that two things share some common area but are not completely the same. For example, if your schedule for one day overlaps with your friend's schedule for that day, there may be some parts of the day where you are both busy, but there are also times where you are free at different times.

Coincide refers to things happening at the same time, while overlap refers to things sharing some common area.

Synchronize.wordDefinition:
Synchronize means to cause two or more things to happen together or at the same time.

The key difference between the two words is that coincide describes something that happens naturally at the same time or place, while synchronize describes the act of deliberately coordinating two or more things to happen at the same time.

videos.Text: He drove us a bit closer to have a look. Looking through binoculars, we could see she was pregnant and it was soon clear she was going to give birth. Herbivores time their births to coincide with the rains, as there's then much more lush grass to eat to raise their young. By all giving birth around the same time, there's less chance of your offspring being the one to get eaten by a predator.

quotes.Text: The instant that movies became described as character driven was the instant when characters stopped mattering in movies. In other words, the birth of the notion of the character-driven movie coincided with the birth of movies in which characters were incidental to the very activities in which they engaged.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Steve Erickson

quotes.Text: In order for the students' development and the outer development of civilization to coincide, we need a faculty whose interest is not limited to specialized educational practices. Rather, this faculty must be fully involved in the broader aspects of life.
quotes.Title: Austrian Philosopher
quotes.Name: Rudolf Steiner

quotes.Text: Being a novelist and being a mother have exactly coincided in my life: the call from my agent saying that I had a contract for my first novel - that was on my answering phone message when I got back from the hospital with my first child.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Barbara Kingsolver

quotes.Text: To praise it would amount to praising myself. For the entire content of the work... coincides almost exactly with my own meditations which have occupied my mind for the past thirty or thirty-five years.
quotes.Title: German Mathematician
quotes.Name: Carl Friedrich Gauss

quotes.Text: Recent warming coincides with rapid growth of human-made greenhouse gases. The observed rapid warming gives urgency to discussions about how to slow greenhouse gas emissions.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: James Hansen

quotes.Text: Conservatives the world over need to grasp the difference between being pro-market and being pro-business. Sometimes the two positions happen to coincide; often they don't.
quotes.Title: British Politician
quotes.Name: Daniel Hannan

quotes.Text: I want to keep an element of myself in every character I play. And maybe that's connected to finding something that you like in every character. Maybe they coincide.
quotes.Title: Irish Actor
quotes.Name: Jamie Dornan

quotes.Text: We need a smaller, leaner Washington. It won't happen if we raise taxes without any coinciding reform and serious slashing of spending.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: David Harsanyi

quotes.Text: I was born too late and missed the dream of empire. Its shadow, the Commonwealth, coincides with my life but rarely connected with it.
quotes.Title: Australian Novelist
quotes.Name: Richard Flanagan

quotes.Text: It's weird when you get roles that coincide with your life.
quotes.Title: English Actress
quotes.Name: Lily James
